<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/tesla-turns-profit-eligible-inclusion-sp-500?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tesla Is Officially the S&P’s Most Eligible Bachelor
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Tesla with a rose on top of it" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODE4L3Rlc2xhX3dpdGhfYV9yb3NlX29uX3RvcF9vZl9pdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, financial analysts and Brew writers alike waited around all day for Tesla’s earnings report like it was George R.R. Martin’s next <em>GoT</em> book. Tesla delivered: The electric automaker posted <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/22/tesla-tsla-earnings-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$104 million</a> in net income, paving the way for inclusion in the S&P 500. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s a big deal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The S&P 500 tracks the performance of 500 of the largest companies listed on U.S. stock exchanges. In order to paint an accurate picture of U.S. stocks, it is occasionally rebalanced—companies are added and removed—by an eight-member Index Committee. The committee uses quantitative and qualitative metrics to determine if a company should be included...but only after it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/21/tesla-isnt-a-gurantee-for-the-sp-500-even-with-year-of-profits.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">becomes eligible</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">How do you become eligible? </strong></span><span>Among other things, do what Tesla just did: Report four consecutive quarters of profitability, including the most recent quarter. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tesla is huge</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether you want to attribute Tesla’s monster ~$295 billion valuation to amateur traders <a href="https://thetradable.com/stocks/the-number-of-robinhood-buyers-of-tesla-tsla-stocks-increased-by-40000-in-one-day?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting that Musk fever</a> or its widening <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/tesla-and-the-science-of-low-cost-next-gen-ev-million-mile-battery.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">technological advantage</a> over competitors, the company’s stock has been going bonkers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It's up over 270% so far this year, including a more than 50% increase in July alone.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla would be the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-knocks-on-s-p-500s-door-11595410201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most valuable company ever</a> added to the index—and larger than <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocks-s-p-500/tesla-extends-rally-as-traders-bet-on-potential-sp-500-entry-idUSKCN24N24C?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">95%</a> of the companies currently listed. And while a potential S&P inclusion might send its stock even further into ludicrous mode...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The S&P bump isn’t really a thing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies do typically see a short term uptick in value, but “this price effect is largely temporary and reverses gradually after the inclusion,” professor Maria Kasch told the WSJ. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The data backs it up: </strong></span><span>Of the 10 companies added to the S&P this year, only five have outperformed the broader index.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But if we've learned one thing, rules don't really apply to Tesla. Shares rose about 4% after hours. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Remember, eligibility ≠ inclusion, but it's hard to see the Index Committee, which can add a company to the S&P at any time, saying no to the world's most valuable automaker.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Tesla said it's going to build its next Gigafactory near Austin, TX. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/us-china-escalate-confrontation-houston-consulate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Houston, We Have a Geopolitical Problem
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. and China have <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/22/politics/china-us-houston-consulate-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entered the ring</a> for Round #137 of their heavyweight bout for economic supremacy. This time, the tussle is over the Chinese Consulate in Houston, TX, which the U.S. ordered shut down late on Tuesday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reason: </strong>The State Department <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-u-s-ordered-us-to-close-our-houston-consulate-11595407075?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accused</a> China of “massive illegal spying and influence operations throughout the United States.” The most recent espionage episode came this week, when U.S. prosecutors charged two Chinese hackers with stealing sensitive coronavirus-related info from American firms.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China called the closure an "unprecedented escalation" and, to fulfill the official rules of Tit-for-Tat Diplomacy, said it would retaliate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is a consulate anyway? </strong>Not to be confused with its stronger, better-looking cousin the embassy, a consulate is a diplomatic outpost inside another country, typically handling smaller issues related to trade, tourists, and expats. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. officials reportedly believed the consulate in Houston was China’s <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/china-vows-to-retaliate-after-us-orders-closure-its-consulate-in-houston/2020/07/22/41e5c6ea-cbf1-11ea-99b0-8426e26d203b_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spying HQ</a>. At the very least, it contained sensitive info: On Tuesday night, police responded to reports of documents being burned on the premises of the consulate.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/yelp-report-shows-may-reopening-push-caused-coronavirus-outbreaks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Yelp Report Gives Reopening Push Zero Stars
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Overhead view of socially distanced restaurant " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODE2L292ZXJoZWFkX3ZpZXdfb2Zfc29jaWFsbHlfZGlzdGFuY2VkX3Jlc3RhdXJhbnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>INA FASSBENDER/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yelp published a report yesterday describing how the past few months have gone for the companies listed on its site. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out, a pandemic isn't great for business. Some of Yelp’s <a href="https://www.yelpeconomicaverage.com/yea-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">main findings</a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When states like Texas and Florida reopened businesses in May, consumers started to resume pre-pandemic activities like going to bars and restaurants. However, those same places experienced caseload spikes in June. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Of all the businesses struggling right now, restaurants are faring the worst. Of the ~26,000 restaurants that have closed since March 1, more than 60% </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/yelp-report-60-of-restaurant-closures-permanent-more-will-close-2020-7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have done so</a></span><span> for good. California, the largest state by population, has also suffered the most permanent restaurant closures, representing 14.4% of the total number. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Between May 25 and July 10, interest in Black-owned business on the site soared 7,000% annually amid a nationwide outcry against systemic racism. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>while total closures are falling, permanent closures are increasing—meaning the ratio of permanent to temporary business closures is also rising. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/mlb-backbut-itll-look-little-different?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Baseball Is Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Baseball warmup " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KsABwXfJBkeTC/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Baseball warmup " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KsABwXfJBkeTC/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After what felt like an inning with six different pitching changes, a rain delay, and a naked guy running onto the field, baseball season is finally <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/mlb/news/mlb-opening-day-2020-five-off-the-field-questions-facing-the-60-game-shortened-season/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returning</a>. Today—nearly four months after its planned March 26 start date—is opening day for the MLB. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here's what's different</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Rules: </strong></span><span>Baseball's long (too long?) 162-game season has been trimmed to 60 games. The league has also decided to adopt universal designated hitters (DHs) to inject more offense into games.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fans:</strong></span><span> As the pandemic continues to get worse before it gets better, the MLB has left it up to local governments to determine whether fans will be allowed to attend games. No teams are currently allowing any fans.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Advertising: </strong></span><span>Ballparks and advertisers are </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/MLBcathedrals/status/1285026950076039169?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting creative</a></span><span> with the extra real estate in the empty bleachers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>So far, <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-sports-ef756085-6f22-4dc5-84de-cf6c03335d40.html?chunk=2&utm_term=twsocialshare#story2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only six</a> of the 10,548 coronavirus tests administered by the MLB have come back positive. But since the MLB isn't playing in a self-contained “bubble” like the NBA, the question remains—will an outbreak cut the season short? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>The Dodgers and the Yankees are the <a href="https://www.sportingnews.com/us/mlb/news/world-series-odds-2020-mlb-favorites-dodgers-yankees/pdtt16a1qqbn1x2iymar56661?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">current World Series favorites</a>, but the machine learning PhDs in the Brew Sports (BS) lab inform us that the Tampa Bay Rays will win.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
She Who Controls the App Store Controls the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Antitrust spotlight on Apple " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODE0L2FudGl0cnVzdF9zcG90bGlnaHRfb25fYXBwbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This week, the Brew is previewing next Monday's antitrust hearing by profiling each Big Tech company at the table. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Company name: </strong>Apple</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Volunteered as tribute:</strong> CEO Tim Cook</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The charges:</strong> To access the 1.5 billion active devices running Apple’s iOS, developers must first pass through the App Store. But Apple's set stringent rules around its App Store, including a 30% cut of sales. The committee will drill down on whether Apple is stifling competition and raising prices for consumers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rebuttal:</strong> Apple <em>literally</em> built the modern app marketplace. iOS apps facilitate hundreds of billions of dollars in e-commerce annually and support millions of jobs. Apple also says its fees are in line with other digital platforms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the entire drama, read our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/antitrust-spotlight-app-store-hurt-developers-overcharge-consumers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">full piece here</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Own the Morning
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Poker GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/8UHQAH44SwTyT9ZiMs/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Poker GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/8UHQAH44SwTyT9ZiMs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Outside of Hermione, ultra-successful people don’t make it to where they are by magic. So the Brew is talking to high-performers to see what makes them tick. First up is professional poker player <a href="https://twitter.com/RealKidPoker?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Daniel Negreanu</a>. Quick bio:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Six-time World Series of Poker bracelet winner</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Third on all-time tournament poker money list</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>449K YouTube subscribers </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We slid into Negreanu’s DMs to ask him how he “owns the morning” and some other questions about life as a professional poker player. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3 things you do in the morning that are essential to starting your day off right: </strong>1) Drink a large bottle of water 2) vegan breakfast 3) workout in the gym, weight training </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing you do in the morning that other people definitely don’t do: </strong>I weigh myself literally every morning.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing about your industry no one outside of it understands:</strong><strong style="color:#000"><em> </em></strong>People think of poker as gambling, and it is...but most jobs are. If you own a restaurant, you are gambling that you will make more money than you spend. If you are a stockbroker, you don't win every day, but if you make good decisions consistently you will make money over the long run.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1 thing that you are weirdly snobby about: </strong>Flights and hotel rooms. I don't waste a lot of money on extravagant things outside of these two things. I fly first class and always look to get a high end hotel room.</p>
</td>

</tr>

Buying demand is sky-high among people who want to take advantage of record-low mortgage rates, but the inventory just isn’t there.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith time ticking, lawmakers are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-aid/trump-republicans-discuss-unemployment-extension-divides-could-stall-action-senators-idUSKCN24N2EF?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill debating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e how to proceed with the extra $600/week in unemployment benefits that are about to expire. Some Republicans are talking about a temporary extension. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/tesla-turns-profit-eligible-inclusion-sp-500?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTesla Is Officially the S\u0026P’s Most Eligible Bachelor\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Tesla with a rose on top of it\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODE4L3Rlc2xhX3dpdGhfYV9yb3NlX29uX3RvcF9vZl9pdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, financial analysts and Brew writers alike waited around all day for Tesla’s earnings report like it was George R.R. Martin’s next \u003cem\u003eGoT\u003c/em\u003e book. Tesla delivered: The electric automaker posted \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/22/tesla-tsla-earnings-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$104 million\u003c/a\u003e in net income, paving the way for inclusion in the S\u0026P 500. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s a big deal\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe S\u0026P 500 tracks the performance of 500 of the largest companies listed on U.S. stock exchanges. In order to paint an accurate picture of U.S. stocks, it is occasionally rebalanced—companies are added and removed—by an eight-member Index Committee. The committee uses quantitative and qualitative metrics to determine if a company should be included...but only after it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/21/tesla-isnt-a-gurantee-for-the-sp-500-even-with-year-of-profits.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecomes eligible\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow do you become eligible? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmong other things, do what Tesla just did: Report four consecutive quarters of profitability, including the most recent quarter. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTesla is huge\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether you want to attribute Tesla’s monster ~$295 billion valuation to amateur traders \u003ca href=\"https://thetradable.com/stocks/the-number-of-robinhood-buyers-of-tesla-tsla-stocks-increased-by-40000-in-one-day?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting that Musk fever\u003c/a\u003e or its widening \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/30/tesla-and-the-science-of-low-cost-next-gen-ev-million-mile-battery.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etechnological advantage\u003c/a\u003e over competitors, the company’s stock has been going bonkers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt's up over 270% so far this year, including a more than 50% increase in July alone.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla would be the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-knocks-on-s-p-500s-door-11595410201?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost valuable company ever\u003c/a\u003e added to the index—and larger than \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocks-s-p-500/tesla-extends-rally-as-traders-bet-on-potential-sp-500-entry-idUSKCN24N24C?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e95%\u003c/a\u003e of the companies currently listed. And while a potential S\u0026P inclusion might send its stock even further into ludicrous mode...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe S\u0026P bump isn’t really a thing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompanies do typically see a short term uptick in value, but “this price effect is largely temporary and reverses gradually after the inclusion,” professor Maria Kasch told the WSJ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe data backs it up: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOf the 10 companies added to the S\u0026P this year, only five have outperformed the broader index.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut if we've learned one thing, rules don't really apply to Tesla. Shares rose about 4% after hours. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eRemember, eligibility ≠ inclusion, but it's hard to see the Index Committee, which can add a company to the S\u0026P at any time, saying no to the world's most valuable automaker.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla said it's going to build its next Gigafactory near Austin, TX. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHouston, We Have a Geopolitical Problem\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. and China have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/22/politics/china-us-houston-consulate-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentered the ring\u003c/a\u003e for Round #137 of their heavyweight bout for economic supremacy. This time, the tussle is over the Chinese Consulate in Houston, TX, which the U.S. ordered shut down late on Tuesday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reason: \u003c/strong\u003eThe State Department \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-u-s-ordered-us-to-close-our-houston-consulate-11595407075?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccused\u003c/a\u003e China of “massive illegal spying and influence operations throughout the United States.” The most recent espionage episode came this week, when U.S. prosecutors charged two Chinese hackers with stealing sensitive coronavirus-related info from American firms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina called the closure an \"unprecedented escalation\" and, to fulfill the official rules of Tit-for-Tat Diplomacy, said it would retaliate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is a consulate anyway? \u003c/strong\u003eNot to be confused with its stronger, better-looking cousin the embassy, a consulate is a diplomatic outpost inside another country, typically handling smaller issues related to trade, tourists, and expats. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. officials reportedly believed the consulate in Houston was China’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/china-vows-to-retaliate-after-us-orders-closure-its-consulate-in-houston/2020/07/22/41e5c6ea-cbf1-11ea-99b0-8426e26d203b_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espying HQ\u003c/a\u003e. At the very least, it contained sensitive info: On Tuesday night, police responded to reports of documents being burned on the premises of the consulate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYelp published a report yesterday describing how the past few months have gone for the companies listed on its site. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out, a pandemic isn't great for business. Some of Yelp’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.yelpeconomicaverage.com/yea-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emain findings\u003c/a\u003e: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen states like Texas and Florida reopened businesses in May, consumers started to resume pre-pandemic activities like going to bars and restaurants. However, those same places experienced caseload spikes in June. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOf all the businesses struggling right now, restaurants are faring the worst. Of the ~26,000 restaurants that have closed since March 1, more than 60% \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/yelp-report-60-of-restaurant-closures-permanent-more-will-close-2020-7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave done so\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for good. California, the largest state by population, has also suffered the most permanent restaurant closures, representing 14.4% of the total number. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBetween May 25 and July 10, interest in Black-owned business on the site soared 7,000% annually amid a nationwide outcry against systemic racism. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewhile total closures are falling, permanent closures are increasing—meaning the ratio of permanent to temporary business closures is also rising. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter what felt like an inning with six different pitching changes, a rain delay, and a naked guy running onto the field, baseball season is finally \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/mlb/news/mlb-opening-day-2020-five-off-the-field-questions-facing-the-60-game-shortened-season/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturning\u003c/a\u003e. Today—nearly four months after its planned March 26 start date—is opening day for the MLB. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHere's what's different\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRules: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBaseball's long (too long?) 162-game season has been trimmed to 60 games. The league has also decided to adopt universal designated hitters (DHs) to inject more offense into games.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFans:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e As the pandemic continues to get worse before it gets better, the MLB has left it up to local governments to determine whether fans will be allowed to attend games. No teams are currently allowing any fans.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAdvertising: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBallparks and advertisers are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MLBcathedrals/status/1285026950076039169?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting creative\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with the extra real estate in the empty bleachers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSo far, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-sports-ef756085-6f22-4dc5-84de-cf6c03335d40.html?chunk=2\u0026utm_term=twsocialshare#story2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly six\u003c/a\u003e of the 10,548 coronavirus tests administered by the MLB have come back positive. But since the MLB isn't playing in a self-contained “bubble” like the NBA, the question remains—will an outbreak cut the season short? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Dodgers and the Yankees are the \u003ca href=\"https://www.sportingnews.com/us/mlb/news/world-series-odds-2020-mlb-favorites-dodgers-yankees/pdtt16a1qqbn1x2iymar56661?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecurrent World Series favorites\u003c/a\u003e, but the machine learning PhDs in the Brew Sports (BS) lab inform us that the Tampa Bay Rays will win.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F07%2F22%2Fmlb-backbut-itll-look-little-different\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; But Apple's set stringent rules around its App Store, including a 30% cut of sales. The committee will drill down on whether Apple is stifling competition and raising prices for consumers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe rebuttal:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple \u003cem\u003eliterally\u003c/em\u003e built the modern app marketplace. iOS apps facilitate hundreds of billions of dollars in e-commerce annually and support millions of jobs. Apple also says its fees are in line with other digital platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the entire drama, read our \u003ca Quick bio:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSix-time World Series of Poker bracelet winner\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThird on all-time tournament poker money list\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e449K YouTube subscribers \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe slid into Negreanu’s DMs to ask him how he “owns the morning” and some other questions about life as a professional poker player. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3 things you do in the morning that are essential to starting your day off right: \u003c/strong\u003e1) Drink a large bottle of water 2) vegan breakfast 3) workout in the gym, weight training \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing you do in the morning that other people definitely don’t do: \u003c/strong\u003eI weigh myself literally every morning.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing about your industry no one outside of it understands:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003ePeople think of poker as gambling, and it is...but most jobs are. If you own a restaurant, you are gambling that you will make more money than you spend. If you are a stockbroker, you don't win every day, but if you make good decisions consistently you will make money over the long run.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1 thing that you are weirdly snobby about: \u003c/strong\u003eFlights and hotel rooms. I don't waste a lot of money on extravagant things outside of these two things. I fly first class and always look to get a high end hotel room.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c!
